Description: Lip and wall sherd (mended from four fragments) with root of handle of North Ionian black-figured pottery bowl; interior slipped streaky brown with two white-red-white bands, reserved band at lip; exterior, cream slip: tongues at lip, occasionally red; handle floral below; friezes divided by stopy maeander bands between bands with superimposed red bands line in white; in belly frieze, bulls to left, with red on haunches and incised details; filling ornament: dotted rosettes and strokes.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.220)
